content:
Run a Bulk Macro on Multiple Records

You can run a bulk macro on multiple records at the same time. Use bulk macros to quickly address similar customer cases or records.

Available in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions (Salesforce Classic); Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions (Lightning Experience)

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To view macros:	Read on macros
To create and edit macros:	Create and Edit on macros
To run bulk macros:	Run Macros on Multiple Records

You need the Manage Macros That Users Can’t Undo permission only if you want to run macros that contain a Submit Action instruction. All bulk macros contain a Submit Action instruction.

The lightning bolt icon () indicates that the macro performs an action—such as sending an email—that cannot be undone.
To run bulk macros, the Enable Enhanced Lists setting must be enabled in your org.

You can run bulk macros on records from the Accounts, Cases, Contacts, and Leads objects. However, you can run a bulk macro only on records in one object list view at a time.

An icon showing a green lightning bolt with two underlines () indicates whether a macro is a bulk macro.

Bulk macros are processed in increments of 10 macros at a time.

In the Case list view, select the cases that you want to run the macro on.
Open the Macros widget.
Select a macro with the green lightning bolt icon () and click Run.
The macro runs on the selected cases. In the list view, the cases on which the macro ran successfully are highlighted in green and denoted by a green check mark icon. Cases that the macro didn’t run successfully on are highlighted in red and denoted by a red X icon. To see an explanation about why the macro didn’t work on a case, hover over the red X icon.
title: Running Bulk Macros in Service Cloud
